issues.description: The problem statement and solution refer to a class named Meal, but in the template repository the file Meal.java declares class Order, and there is a duplicate Order.java file. There is no class named Meal in the template, causing students to be unable to find or implement the intended Meal class and leading to duplicate Order classes.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the class in Meal.java from Order to Meal, remove or consolidate the extra Order.java file, ensuring there is a single Meal class matching the problem specification and the solution implementation.

issues.description: The problem statement and solution refer to a class named Meal (and use Meal in method signatures), but the template repository instead declares and uses a class named Order for the same concept. This mismatch will confuse students mapping the problem’s Meal concept to the provided code.
issues.suggested_fix: Rename the template’s Order class to Meal (update class declaration and file name to Meal.java), and adjust references in Main.java and other code to use Meal to match the problem statement and solution.
